Class Die

java.lang.Object
  Die

public class Die
extends java.lang.Object

The Die class represents all the properties and behaviours of a die in the Yahtzee game. This class keeps a track of each die's values, its rolling, and also determines a die's locked state.

Version:
11/10/2007
Author:
Kitty Jasika Miranda

Field Summary
private  int dieValue
           
private  boolean locked
          initialises the lock to control the die
 
Constructor Summary
Die()
          Constructor 1: Instantiates a die with a zero value and defines die to be unlocked.

 boolean isLocked()

initialises the lock to control the die

Constructor Detail

Die

public Die()
Constructor 1: Instantiates a die with a zero value and defines die to be unlocked.

Method Detail

getValue

public int getValue()
Returns:
the value of a die when it is rolled.

isLocked

public boolean isLocked()
This boolean method returns true if and only if the die is locked otherwise retrun false as defined in the constructor.

resetDie

public void resetDie()
This method changes the values of a die to its initial values as defined in the constructor so that the next player can have his turn.

roll

public void roll()
This method rolls the five dice randomly. If a die is locked it does not roll again and thus the value of that die is preserved. Only the unlocked die is rolled each time when this method is called.

setDie

public void setDie(int val)
Parameters:
val - sets the value of a die to a new value. (from 1 to 6)

setLock

public void setLock(boolean lock)
Parameters:
lock - sets the locked state of the die (to true or false) This mutator (setter) method changes the locked status of a die.
